com.theeyetribe.clientsdk

Class GazeManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.theeyetribe.clientsdk.GazeManager

  • public class GazeManager
extends java.lang.Object
    GazeManager is the main entry point of the EyeTribe Java SDK. It exposes all routines associated to gaze control.

    Using this class a developer can connect to the EyeTribe Server, calibrate the eye tracking system and attach listeners to receive live data streams of GazeData updates. Note that this is a thin wrapper class. The Core SDK implementation can be found in GazeManagerCore.

    GazeManager must establish a connection to the EyeTribe Server before it can be used. This is achieved by calling activate. GazeManager must be shut down by calling deactivate.

    A standard pattern for using GazeManager in a Java FX Application can be seen below: 

     public class Main extends Application{

     public static void main(String[] args)
     {
         launch(args);
     }

     \@Override
     public void start(Stage primaryStage) throws Exception
     {
         GazeManager.getInstance().activateAsync();
     }

     \@Override
     public void stop() throws Exception
     {
         GazeManager.getInstance().deactivate();
     }
 }

      • activate

        public boolean activate()
        Activates EyeTribe Java SDK and all underlying routines using default values. Latest API version will be used in client mode PUSH. This call is synchronous and calling thread is locked during initialization.

        To shutdown, the deactivate method must be called.

        Returns:
        true if successfully activated, false otherwise

      • activate

        public boolean activate(com.theeyetribe.clientsdk.GazeManagerCore.ApiVersion version,
                        com.theeyetribe.clientsdk.GazeManagerCore.ClientMode mode)
        Deprecated. as of EyeTribe Server v.0.9.77 ClientMode Push is default
        Activates EyeTribe Java SDK and all underlying routines. This call is synchronous and calling thread is locked during initialization.

        To shutdown, the deactivate method must be called.

        Parameters:
        version - Version number of the Tracker API that this client will be compliant to
        mode - Mode though which the client will receive GazeData. Either ClientMode.PUSH or ClientMode.PULL
        Returns:
        true if successfully activated, false otherwise

      • activate

        public boolean activate(com.theeyetribe.clientsdk.GazeManagerCore.ApiVersion version,
                        com.theeyetribe.clientsdk.GazeManagerCore.ClientMode mode,
                        IConnectionStateListener listener)
        Deprecated. as of EyeTribe Server v.0.9.77 ClientMode Push is default
        Activates EyeTribe Java SDK and all underlying routines. This call is synchronous and calling thread is locked during initialization.

        To shutdown, the deactivate method must be called.

        Parameters:
        version - Version number of the Tracker API that this client will be compliant to
        mode - Mode though which the client will receive GazeData. Either ClientMode.PUSH or ClientMode.PULL
        listener - Listener to notify once the connection to EyeTribe Server has been established
        Returns:
        true if successfully activated, false otherwise

      • activate

        public boolean activate(com.theeyetribe.clientsdk.GazeManagerCore.ApiVersion version,
                        com.theeyetribe.clientsdk.GazeManagerCore.ClientMode mode,
                        java.lang.String hostname,
                        int portnumber,
                        IConnectionStateListener listener)
        Deprecated. as of EyeTribe Server v.0.9.77 ClientMode Push is default
        Activates EyeTribe Java SDK and all underlying routines. This call is synchronous and calling thread is locked during initialization.

        To shutdown, the deactivate method must be called.

        Parameters:
        version - Version number of the Tracker API that this client will be compliant to
        mode - Mode though which the client will receive GazeData. Either ClientMode.PUSH or ClientMode.PULL
        hostname - The host name or IP address where the eye tracking server is running
        portnumber - The port number used for the eye tracking server
        listener - Listener to notify once the connection to EyeTribe Server has been established
        Returns:
        true if successfully activated, false otherwise

      • activateAsync

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Boolean> activateAsync()
        Activates EyeTribe Java SDK and all underlying routines using default values. Latest API version will be used in client mode PUSH. This call is asynchronous.

        To shutdown, the deactivate method must be called.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the pending connection attempt

        mode - Mode though which the client will receive GazeData. Either ClientMode.PUSH or ClientMode.PULL
        hostname - The host name or IP address where the eye tracking server is running
        portnumber - The port number used for the eye tracking server
        listener - Listener to notify once the connection to EyeTribe Server has been established *
        Returns:
        a Future representing the pending connection attempt

      • activateAsync

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Boolean> activateAsync(com.theeyetribe.clientsdk.GazeManagerCore.ApiVersion version,
                                                                    com.theeyetribe.clientsdk.GazeManagerCore.ClientMode mode,
                                                                    java.lang.String hostname,
                                                                    int portnumber)
        Deprecated. as of EyeTribe Server v.0.9.77 ClientMode Push is default
        Activates EyeTribe Java SDK and all underlying routines. This call is asynchronous.

        To shutdown, the deactivate method must be called.

        Parameters:
        version - Version number of the Tracker API that this client will be compliant to
        mode - Mode though which the client will receive GazeData. Either ClientMode.PUSH or ClientMode.PULL
        hostname - The host name or IP address where the eye tracking server is running
        portnumber - The port number used for the eye tracking server
        Returns:
        a Future representing the pending connection attempt

      • activateAsync

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Boolean> activateAsync(com.theeyetribe.clientsdk.GazeManagerCore.ApiVersion version,
                                                                    com.theeyetribe.clientsdk.GazeManagerCore.ClientMode mode,
                                                                    java.lang.String hostname,
                                                                    int portnumber,
                                                                    long timeOut)
        Deprecated. as of EyeTribe Server v.0.9.77 ClientMode Push is default
        Activates EyeTribe Java SDK and all underlying routines. This call is asynchronous.

        To shutdown, the deactivate method must be called.

        Parameters:

        mode - Mode though which the client will receive GazeData. Either ClientMode.PUSH or ClientMode.PULL

        portnumber - The port number used for the eye tracking server
        timeOut - time out in milliseconds of connection attempt
        Returns:
        a Future representing the pending connection attempt

      • activateAsync

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Boolean> activateAsync(com.theeyetribe.clientsdk.GazeManagerCore.ApiVersion version,
                                                                    com.theeyetribe.clientsdk.GazeManagerCore.ClientMode mode,
                                                                    java.lang.String hostname,
                                                                    int portnumber,
                                                                    long timeOut,
                                                                    int retries)
        Deprecated. as of EyeTribe Server v.0.9.77 ClientMode Push is default
        Activates EyeTribe Java SDK and all underlying routines. This call is asynchronous.

        During the set timeout, an amount of connection retries will be attempted.

        To shutdown, the deactivate method must be called.

        Parameters:
        version - Version number of the Tracker API that this client will be compliant to
        mode - Mode though which the client will receive GazeData. Either ClientMode.PUSH or ClientMode.PULL
        hostname - The host name or IP address where the eye tracking server is running
        portnumber - The port number used for the eye tracking server
        timeOut - time out in milliseconds of connection attempt
        retries - number of times to retry connection attempt in the timeout period
        Returns:
        a Future representing the pending connection attempt

      • activateAsync

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Boolean> activateAsync(long timeOut,
                                                                    int retries)
        Activates EyeTribe Java SDK and all underlying routines using default values. Latest API version will be used in client mode PUSH. This call is asynchronous.

        During the set timeout, an amount of connection retries will be attempted.

        To shutdown, the deactivate method must be called.

        Parameters:
        timeOut - time out in milliseconds of connection attempt
        retries - number of times to retry connection attempt in the timeout period
        Returns:
        a Future representing the pending connection attempt

      • getHeartbeatMillis

        public int getHeartbeatMillis()
        Deprecated. as of EyeTribe Server v.0.9.77 using Heartbeat no longer has any effect
        Length of a heartbeat in milliseconds

        The EyeTribe Server defines the desired length of a heartbeat and is in this implementation automatically acquired through the Tracker API.

        Returns:
        heartbeatlength in milliseconds

      • getLastCalibrationResult

        public CalibrationResult getLastCalibrationResult()
        The latest performed and valid CalibrationResult. Note the result is not necessarily positive and clients should evaluate the result before using.
        Returns:
        last valid CalibrationResult if any, null otherwise

      • framePull

        public void framePull()
        Deprecated. as of EyeTribe Server v.0.9.77 ClientMode Push is default
        If running in ClientMode.PULL, this call request the latest gaze frame from the server. Registered IGazeListener instances will receive the frame.

      • calibrationStart

        public boolean calibrationStart(int numCalibrationPoints,
                                ICalibrationProcessHandler listener)
        Initiate a new calibration process. Must be called before any calls to CalibrationPointStart or calibrationPointEnd.

        Any previous (and possible running) calibration process must be completed or aborted before calling this. Otherwise the server will return an error.

        A full calibration process consists of a number of calls to calibrationPointStart and calibrationPointEnd matching the total number of calibration points set by the numCalibrationPoints parameter.

        This call is synchronous and calling thread is locked while request is processed.

        Parameters:
        numCalibrationPoints - The number of calibration points that will be used in this calibration
        listener - The ICalibrationProcessHandler instance that will receive callbacks during the calibration process
        Returns:
        true if a new calibration process was successfully started, false otherwise

      • calibrationStartAsync

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Boolean> calibrationStartAsync(int numCalibrationPoints,
                                                                            ICalibrationProcessHandler listener)
        Initiate a new calibration process. Must be called before any calls to CalibrationPointStart or calibrationPointEnd.

        Any previous (and possible running) calibration process must be completed or aborted before calling this. Otherwise the server will return an error.

        A full calibration process consists of a number of calls to calibrationPointStart and calibrationPointEnd matching the total number of calibration points set by the numCalibrationPoints parameter.

        This call is asynchronous.

        Parameters:
        numCalibrationPoints - The number of calibration points that will be used in this calibration
        listener - The ICalibrationProcessHandler instance that will receive callbacks during the calibration process
        Returns:
        a Future representing the pending calibration start attempt

      • calibrationPointStart

        public void calibrationPointStart(int x,
                                  int y)
        Called for every calibration point during a calibration process. This call should be followed by a call to calibrationPointEnd 1-2 seconds later.

        The calibration process must be initiated by a call to calibrationStart before calling this.

        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the calibration point
        y - Y coordinate of the calibration point

      • calibrationPointEnd

        public void calibrationPointEnd()
        Called for every calibration point during a calibration process. This should be called 1-2 seconds after calibrationPointStart.

        The calibration process must be initiated by a call to calibrationStart before calling this.

      • calibrationAbort

        public boolean calibrationAbort()
        Cancels an ongoing calibration process.

        This call is synchronous and calling thread is locked while request is processed.

        Returns:
        True is request successful, false otherwise

      • calibrationAbortAsync

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Boolean> calibrationAbortAsync()
        Cancels an ongoing calibration process.

        This call is asynchronous.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the pending calibration abort attempt

      • calibrationClear

        public void calibrationClear()
        Resets calibration state, canceling any previous calibrations.

      • switchScreen

        public boolean switchScreen(int screenIndex,
                            int screenResW,
                            int screenResH,
                            float screenPsyW,
                            float screenPsyH)
        Switch currently active screen. Enabled the user to take control of which screen is used for calibration and gaze control.

        This call is synchronous and calling thread is locked while request is processed.

        Parameters:
        screenIndex - Index of next screen. On windows 'Primary Screen' has index 0
        screenResW - Screen resolution width in pixels
        screenResH - Screen resolution height in pixels
        screenPsyW - Physical Screen width in meters
        screenPsyH - Physical Screen height in meters
        Returns:
        True if request successful, false otherwise

      • switchScreenAsync

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Boolean> switchScreenAsync(int screenIndex,
                                                                        int screenResW,
                                                                        int screenResH,
                                                                        float screenPsyW,
                                                                        float screenPsyH)
        Switch currently active screen. Enabled the user to take control of which screen is used for calibration and gaze control.

        This call is asynchronous.

        Parameters:
        screenIndex - Index of next screen. On windows 'Primary Screen' has index 0
        screenResW - Screen resolution width in pixels
        screenResH - Screen resolution height in pixels
        screenPsyW - Physical Screen width in meters
        screenPsyH - Physical Screen height in meters
        Returns:
        a Future representing the pending screen switch attempt
